studyAmendmentImpacts.description: Discontinuation of Blinded Independent Central Review (BICR) for disease progression assessment following final PFS analyses.
Discontinuation of irRECIST-defined antitumor activity data collection.
Introduction of a specific laboratory test schedule post IA3 cut-off date.
Updated safety monitoring guidelines for myocarditis including BNP and Troponin.

studyAmendmentReasons.reasonText: Final analyses for PFS have been performed as specified in the protocol, allowing transition to investigator-assessed progression.
Alignment with PACL dated 02 September 2019 regarding irRECIST data collection.
Occurrence of myocarditis cases in early phases of treatment necessitated enhanced cardiac monitoring.

studyChanges.beforeText: Confirmed disease progression by BICR assessment
studyChanges.afterText: After review of images by BICR is stopped... permanent discontinuation of treatment will be performed as per investigator-assessed disease progression.
studyChanges.summary: Transitioned progression assessment from BICR to Investigator assessment after final PFS analysis.

studyChanges.beforeText: irRECIST-defined antitumor activity will be collected.
studyChanges.afterText: irRECIST-defined antitumor activity will no longer be collected as per PACL dated 02 September 2019.
Table 8. Required Laboratory Tests Post IA3 Cut Off Date (28-Apr-2020)
studyChanges.summary: Added a new table for laboratory requirements following the third interim analysis cut-off.

studyChanges.afterText: monitor patients at regular intervals... including MUGA/Echocardiogram, ECG, BNP, troponin and CK-MB monitoring.
studyChanges.summary: Added specific cardiac biomarkers and imaging for myocarditis monitoring.
